I can't believe I never wrote a review for this title. Better late than never I guess. You would be hard pressed to find a more engrossing coop experience. This game is the best there is when it comes to humorous, challenging and intelligent problem solving scenarios. Even If you are not the puzzle games type, this title will turn you around. Satisfying content, lengthy game play with never ending replayablity when you consider the time trials or more importantly, the community produced content. I give this game a 9.5 out of 10.

Way better than the first one. The story elements really push you to continue instead of depending solely on a vague sense of completion. Wheatley is great, and voice acting in general is huge. The physics have also been cleaned up a bit and everything is just smoother. Loved it.

To start out with, Portal 2 breaks the mold when it comes to sophomoric sequels. P2 gives the player a richly deeper story dive into the Appature Science facility further cementing the story crafting of Valve. The game is full exhilarating moments and witty comedy including the top notch performance by Stephen Merchant. 

The addition of the multiplayer gameplay is something very common these days, except Portal 2 adds a different twist to with this one. The multiplayer environment allows 2 players to join together to tackle a myriad of "test chambers" specifically designed for 2 players. 

This game is a great mixture of fun and story. A true must have for gamers of any level.
u actually talk to a potato 10/10

There is no reason for you to not own this game. It is cheap and the best writing you will encounter in a video game period. I've played through the whole thing multiple times and the charming characters mixed with witty puzzles will charm your pants off. Furthermore, best two player co-op I've ever experienced.

One of the greatest games I have ever played

My first ever game on Steam, and among my favourites of all time. In fact, at first I registered on Steam solely just to play this game. My first username "p-body" also originated from Portal 2.

I absolutely adore the concept of Portal and its sequel, navigating through puzzles using portals, cubes and other fun gameplay elements. The main mode of the game (singleplayer) has a simple, but thoroughly enjoyable plot. GLaDOS is one of my favourite antagonists in a video game. Portal and Portal 2 are both very important parts of internet and gaming culture.

Co-op is also a fine addition to the game, giving two players even more puzzles and an interesting challenge: they have to work together to complete the tests and only together can they do that. I put countless hours into both parts of the game, having replayed the story about a dozen times and playing through co-op with many good steam friends of mine. In-fact, it was Portal 2 where I met most of my true steam friends who some of them I even know in real life.

Then there's the third major part of the game: creating test chambers yourself. I'm gonna tell you something, I suck at it. Look through my workshop, I only created stupid things like a giant turret. However, people still really liked that concept and that's what made it so captivating for me. You can do great puzzles and share them, which others will appreciate and play them with an already deep dedication for the game. And, if you feel like doing a short story, Hammer is always at your side with all the tools necessary.

Portal 2 is a masterpiece that you will love for its ingenious story, gameplay is very entertaining, dialog is brilliant, almost everything about it is extremely well done. When I was finished it left me wanted more.

There are a few negatives, like too many loading screens and levels are a little too easy with only one solution to complete them. With the original Portal I felt I had more freedom to complete the puzzles in different ways.

Overall Portal 2 is a fun, funny and fantasic game that I recommend everyone should get if for some reason you already haven't.

Top 10 greatest games of all time? I think so! Portal 2 improves on its already excellent predecessor as you delve deep into the bowels of the Aperture testing facility. 

How do you improve on a game that was already excellent you ask?

Workshop support
Two person co-op 
Longer campain
Solid lore
Character development.

If you are a fan of the original portal I'd tell you to buy it but you most likely already own it, so the rest of you pick them both up as a bundle next time they are on sale. You will not regret it.

Great game, the addition of Cave Johnson infused the game with a ton of humor. Now with the ability to create or download NEW test chambers!  I still find myself returning to the game even after years of owning it to explore different ways to complete the puzzles.  The storyline still gets a chuckle as well.
Tres bonne suite! C'est le 1er en mieux

Portal 2 make some serious improvements over the first. It tells a great story with much comedic flavor. The recent addition of the "Community Test Chambers" adds new life into this already amazing game. This is a must buy for any gamer out there! 10/10!
This is probably the best puzzle game of the last 5 years. I make community maps and really love this game. (at 100 hours played)
PERFECT mixture of a puzzle game, good storyline and amazing co-op play. 10/10
its PORTAL!!! :) at its BEST!!!
One of the best games I've played. Fantastic fun and absolutely worth picking up.

Taking place 200 years later after Portal, Portal 2 puts you once again into Chell's body. After a (very) long sleep in a relaxation chamber, you wake up in that same place and discover a new friend. Here begins another story starring you, GlaDOS and that unknown friend.

-Single-player
-Multi-player (2 players)
-Cross-platform support (PC/Mac players can play with PS3 players and vice-versa)
-Authoring Tools

This is, without a doubt, one of the best games of contemporary PC gaming, let alone PC gaming in general. The gameplay is clever, innovative, and mind-bending; the wit, charm, and humor are equally so. Environments ooze with atmosphere, from the comical to the tense. Portal 2 is easily one of the most memorable games I've played. If you haven't picked it up yet, do yourself a favor and grab it. You won't regret it.
A great first person puzzle game.

Mucha gente me comentó al jugar el 1º portal que me parecería un simple prologo cuando empezase el 2º. ¡Totalmente cierto! Tiene todo lo visto, solo que mas y mejor, como decían en cierto programa de radio.

No os perdáis el cooperativo, grandioso "epilogo" (ya os entrareis al jugar la campaña) y si ya lo tenéis ¡Regaladlo a un amigo, difundid el amor

In the sequel to Valve's inovative puzzle game Portal, everything's bigger, better and funnier. Introducing new characters, puzzles and a new co-op-mode (and not to mention the ability to let players create and share their own puzzles) makes this a must-have in every gamer's library.
Epic Game!!!
Game of the decade !!

Portal 2 is an amazing game. If you enjoyed Portal, you'll instantly fall in love with Portal 2 even more. The Co-Op mode is an amazing bonus to this game, with added story to play through, so you'll love it. The fun doesn't stop there, as you can explore an almost endless amount of community test chambers, and create your own! Definitely worth whatever price it is at whatever given time!

"Hello! This is the part where you die!"

*achievement unlocked: This is the part where you die!*
-this is that part.

Quite possibly the most exciting and nerdtastic moment of my life. This is what I love about this series of video games. It doesn't rely on cheap pop culture reference inserts to grab its audience, or to make a cheap laugh. It creates the pop culture reference! Something this spectacular makes you sit back and say "yeah, I was there" as you tell your grand kids about it in 30 years.

This game rocks all of humanites socks, and no matter how many Chinamen we get to mass produce socks, it'll never be enough! If you value yourself as a gamer, play this game!

This game is a no-brainer; if you don't own it yet, you're doing something wrong. Especially since it's always on sale now. You have no reason not to get this game. The writing is humorous and clever, the puzzles are fun and creative, and the Steam Workshop provides hours of extra possible playtime. Mix that in with good music and a stellar Co-Op mode and you have yourself one of the best games of the generation.
Un seguito degno dell'originale
